isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 MODEL - DETROIT DIESEL SERIES 60 ENGINE - TROUBLESHOOTING - CRUISE/PTO CONTROL SYSTEM AND RELATED COMPONENTS - DETROIT DIESEL

svcproc.title: CRUISE/PTO CONTROL SYSTEM AND RELATED COMPONENTS - DETROIT DIESEL

svcprocinfo.para: Inspect TPS/IVS circuits and connectors as outlined in Before Troubleshooting.

important.para: The following cruise control test procedures must be performed in the sequence that they appear in this manual. Each test relies on information from the previous test procedure.

note.para: The clutch switch is a normally open switch, adjusted to be closed when the pedal is in the released (foot off) position.
Use the EST to check clutch switch operation. If the EST indicates the clutch switch is not operating properly, perform this procedure.

entry.para: Visually check clutch switch adjustment. The switch should be adjusted to open with an audible click when the pedal is depressed 0.5 inch (13 mm). Is clutch switch adjusted properly?
Disconnect clutch switch pigtail from cab harness at connector (55). With pedal released, measure resistance across pigtail connector terminals.
If switch is properly adjusted, replace the switch.
Depress clutch pedal and measure resistance across pigtail connector (55) terminals.
If switch is properly adjusted, replace the switch.
At cab side of connector (55), measure resistance of 97-GH to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in gnd. path for circuit 97-GH, 97-GA, 97-G, or 11-G between connector (55) and negative battery terminal, then repair.
Disconnect ECM connector (341) from ECM. Use test lead to jumper terminal J2 (circuit 97AH) to ground. At connector (55) measure resistance to ground at circuit 97AH.
The clutch switch and circuits check good.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97AH between connectors (341) and (55), then repair.

svcsubproc.title: Testing Service Brake Switch And Circuits - Detroit Diesel
svcsubproc.para: Inspect circuits and connectors as outlined in Before Troubleshooting.

note.para: Use the EST to check service brake switch operation. If the EST indicates the service brake switch is not operating properly, perform this procedure.
Vehicle air brake system must be fully charged for this test.

table.title: Testing Service Brake Switch And Circuits - Detroit Diesel

entry.para: Remove harness connector (5) from service brake switch. Measure resistance to ground at both service brake switch terminals.
At service brake switch (5), measure resistance between the two terminals with brakes released.
At service brake switch (5), measure resistance between the two terminals with brakes applied.
At service brake switch harness connector (5), measure resistance to ground at circuit 97-GF.
Locate open or poor connection in ground path for circuit 97-GF, 97-GA, 97-G, or 11-G between connector (5) and negative battery terminal, then repair.
Remove ECM connector (341) from the ECM. At connector (341) measure resistance to ground at terminal G2 (circuit 97AL).
Locate short to ground in circuit 97AL between connectors (341) and (5), then repair.
Use test lead to jumper terminal G2 (circuit 97AL) to ground at (341). At connector (5) measure resistance to ground at circuit 97AL.
The service brake switch and circuits check good.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97AL between connectors (341) and (5), then repair.

svcsubproc.title: Testing Cruise On/Off Switch - Detroit Diesel
svcsubproc.para: Inspect circuits and connectors as outlined in Before Troubleshooting.

note.para: Use EST to check cruise on/off switch operation. If the EST indicates the cruise on/off switch is not operating properly, perform this procedure.

table.title: Testing Cruise On/Off Switch - Detroit Diesel

entry.para: Remove connector (419) from on/off switch. With switch in on position, measure resistance between terminals 5 and 6.
With switch (419) in off position, measure resistance between terminals 5 and 6.
To test switch light function, connect 12V lead to terminal 7 and ground terminal 8. Does light turn on?
Disconnect ECM connector (341) from the ECM. At connector (341) measure resistance from terminal F2, (circuit 97AE) to ground.
Locate short to ground in circuit 97AE between connectors (341) and (419), then repair.
At connector (419), measure resistance to ground at circuit 97-GC.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97-GC, 97-GA, 97-G or 11-G to negative battery terminal, then repair.
Connect (419) to cruise on/off switch and turn switch to on position. At connector (341) measure resistance of F2 to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97AE between connectors (341) and (419), then repair.

svcsubproc.title: Testing Cruise Set/Resume Switch And Circuits - Detroit Diesel
svcsubproc.para: Inspect circuits and connectors as outlined in Before Troubleshooting.

note.para: Use the EST to check set/resume switch operation. If the EST indicates the set/resume switch is not operating properly, perform this procedure.

table.title: Testing Cruise Set/Resume Switch And Circuits - Detroit Diesel

entry.para: Remove connector (418) from cruise set/resume switch. With switch in set position, measure resistance between terminals 2 and 3.
With switch (418) in neutral position, measure resistance between terminals 1, 2, and 3.
With switch (418) in resume position, measure resistance between terminals 1 and 2.
To test switch light function, connect 12V lead to terminal 7 and ground to terminal 8. Does LED light turn on?
At connector (418) measure resistance to ground at circuit 97-GB.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97-GB, 97-GA, 97-G, or 11-G to negative battery terminal, then repair.
Disconnect ECM connector (341). Measure resistance from terminal G3 to ground.
Locate short to ground in circuit 97AA, then repair.
Disconnect ECM connector (341). Measure resistance from terminal J1 (circuit 97AB) to ground.
Locate short to ground in circuit 97AB, then repair.
With set/resume switch disconnected, at connector (341) measure resistance between terminal G3 and J1 (circuit 97AA to 97AB).
Locate short between circuits 97AA and 97AB, then repair.
At connector (341), measure voltage from J1 (circuit 97AB) to ground.
Locate short to unwanted voltage source, then repair.
At connector (341), measure voltage from G3 (circuit 97AA) to ground.
Locate short to unwanted voltage source, then repair.
At connector (341) use test lead to jumper terminal G3 (circuit 97AA) to ground. At connector (418) measure resistance between circuits 97AA and 97-GB.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97AA between connectors (418) and (341), then repair.
At connector (341) use test lead to jumper terminal J1 (circuit 97AB) to ground. At connector (418) measure resistance between circuits 97AB and 97-GB.
The cruise set/ resume switch and circuits check good.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97AB between connectors (418) and (341), then repair.
